text: The Cooper's Bluff Site is a prehistoric panel of pictographs (painted rock art) in Searcy County, Arkansas. Located under a sheltering overhang, it measures about , and is accompanied by a scatter of prehistoric Native American artifacts. It is estimated to have been painted about 1500 CE. The site was listed on the National Register of Historic Places in 1982. ==See also== *National Register of Historic Places listings in Searcy County, Arkansas ==References== Category:Archaeological sites on the National Register of Historic Places in Arkansas Category:Searcy County, Arkansas Category:Rock art in North America Category:National Register of Historic Places in Searcy County, Arkansas
title: Cooper's Bluff Site
